page.title: 09THE WORK OF A PARK RANGER.
page.content: The Ranger,whose area of 86 sq.miles includes our particular "BLOCK" is Mr.Weekes & he is assisted at the weekend by volunteer rangers.His work is interesting because it is so diverse.Daily he patrols his area to give information or assistance when required.He helps farmers,particularly if there is an outbreak of foot & mouth disease.At another time he might be called out during the night because of an accident on the moors,when his knowledge of the terrain means that a search & rescue can be undertaken quickly.For eight days in August he controls acess to the shooting moors. He supervises volunteer parties which pick up the litter of modern society left by the unthinking visitor.Or perhaps he liaises with the police to catch thieves who steal the eggs of rare birds.
